etymology.description: 八(八) (bā, "eight") — represents two bent lines indicating division
etymology.interpretation: The character visually depicts two lines that suggest the concept of separation or dividing into parts, emphasizing the transformation of the number concept from division to the numeral 'eight' itself.

examples.chinese: 我有八个苹果(我有八個蘋果)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǒu bā gè píngguǒ。(I have eight apples.)

examples.chinese: 八(八)是一个幸运的数字(八是個幸運的數字)。
examples.pinyin: Bā shì yīgè xìngyùn de shùzì。(Eight is a lucky number.)

examples.chinese: 我们班有八个学生(我們班有八個學生)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bān yǒu bā gè xuéshēng。(There are eight students in our class.)
examples.english: There are eight students in our class.
